result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis John Akey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Not Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
*Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program, but not until after 18 months have been served
*92 days of incarceration credit

superMiscConds.notes:
*Pay a fine of $600 plus costs/surcharges 
*Defendant is required to authorize the department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account to be used for payment of obligations in reasonable amounts as determined by DOC. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
*Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

*DL Revocation - Lifetime
*Sign releases of information for his agent so agent can monitor compliance
*Participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
*Provide DNA Sample

superTimeConds.notes: *IID - 36 months on any vehicle owned or operated by the defendant

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Postconviction Relief filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner

Count 1:  Imposed Prison Sentence with Extended Supervision
Count 2:  Dismissed and Read In
Count 3:  Dismissed and Read In

1:36 PM Defendant Travis John Akey in court, in custody.  District Attorney (DA) Louis J Molepske, Jr. appears on behalf of Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Robert J Jambois for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Travis John Akey. 
Cases heard today are 22CF140, 22TR498 and 22TR499.

Court calls the cases.
DA Molepske states the appearances.

DA Molepske states that the initial plea offer is invalid and states this on the record.
DA Molepske states case law on the record that he is referencing.
Court reviews the statute that had been state on the record.
DA Molepske references an additional case law on the record.
Atty Bergner responds to the statements of DA Molepske and his client still wishes to proceed to sentencing today.
Court would like Atty Bergner to spend a little extra time with his client to explain the changes that had been stated on the record to make 
sure he understands and if he then wishes to still to proceed to sentencing.
If he does not choose to proceed the Court will find good cause for an adjournment.
1:46 p.m.  Court is in recess.
2:01 p.m.  Court is back in session with the appearances remaining as they previously were.
Atty Bergner has gone over the changes with his client and they still wish to proceed with today's sentencing.
Court questions the defendant.
Court informs the defendant of the current sentence.
BY THE COURT:
Defendant is proceeding with the knowledge of the changes and court finds that he is doing this knowingly and intelligently.

Prior Pleas Entered: 
22CF140:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 3 - Dismissed and Read In 

22TR498:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In

22TR499:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Cases dismissed and read in:
22TR498
22TR499

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Court makes statements and indicates that he has reviewed the CCAP record and puts his findings on the record.
DA Molepske makes additional statements.
2:15 p.m.  Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Court questions Atty Bergner with regards to the incarceration credit.
Atty Bergner responds.
Defendant makes a statement prior to his sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
22CF140:
Count 1 -
Impose a 66 month Determinate Prison Sentence
Initial Confinement:  18 months 
Not Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program, but not until after 18 months have been served
92 days of incarceration credit
Extended Supervision:  48 months
**Conditions of Extended Supervision:
*Pay fine of $600 plus costs
*DL Revocation - Lifetime 
*IID - 36 months on any vehicle owned or operated by the defendant
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
*Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations. 
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Sign releases of information for his agent so agent can monitor compliance
*Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. 
*Participate in any counseling or assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
*Provide DNA Sample

records.addlTxt:
8:30 AM Defendant Travis John Akey in court.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Travis John Akey. 
Court calls the case.
ADA Jambois states appearances.
Matter is set for a final pre-trial.
Atty Jambois states that the defendant will be submitting a plea.
Atty Bergner makes statements regarding the plea being submitted at a later date.
Court questions Atty Bergner.

8:32 AM Court takes a brief recess to allow Atty Bergner to review the plea documentation with the defendant.
8:45 AM Court resumes. Appearances are the same as before the recess.

Atty Bergner is ready to proceed.
Atty Jambois states the plea agreement.
Atty Bergner concurs with the agreement as stated.
Defendant concurs with the agreement.
The plea questionnaire was submitted. Court reviews the document.
Court questions Atty Bergner regarding the plea questionnaire.
Court questions the defendant regarding the plea questionnaire, as well as the maximum fines and penalties that could be imposed.
Court questions the defendant regarding what elements the State would need to prove at trial.

DEFENDANT'S PLEA:
Count 1: No Contest

Before accepting the plea, court questions the defendant regarding his rights.
Court questions the defendant, further, regarding possible penalties.
Court informs the defendant how dismissed and read in charges may be considered.
Defendant states he has had enough time to discuss this matter with Atty Bergner.
Court questions Atty Bergner regarding the defendant's plea.

BY THE COURT:
No Contest plea is accepted.

Parties stipulate there is a factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds the defendant guilty of charge 1.
Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.
Judgment of conviction to be entered as of today's date.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:08 PM Defendant Travis Akey appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Maxwell Bergner for Travis Akey appeared in court, Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of OWI 5th offense, Possession of Meth, Possession of THC as 2nd or subsequent, Possession of a schedule III narcotic drug. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner makes bond arguments requesting smaller cash bond. 
Court questions the prior OWI conviction. 
Atty Dodge responds. 

Court will set 22TR498 and 22TR499 for the same date and time as this hearing.
Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
